messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] just joined
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Allan, Yabu is a Japanese Bush as in Plant. In the Book Shogun by James Clavell, who was a prisoner of War in a Japanese WW II Prisoner Camp, where he
messages.messageBody:
Hello Allan,

Yabu is a Japanese Bush as in Plant. In the Book Shogun by James Clavell, who was a prisoner of War in a Japanese WW II Prisoner Camp, where he learned a lot about the Japanese and saw many autrocities, later as a Novelist he wrote Shogun and made the Lord Yabu a Shogun throughout the book, but he is actually a ficticious figure and feudal lord.

Shaku-Oh-Cho
----- Original Message -----
From: Allan
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, June 12, 2003 5:17 PM
Subject: [samuraihistory] just joined


Hello. I'm looking for a historical japanese figure by the name
of "Yabu". He was either a samurai or shogun. Can anyone help?

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] just joined
messages.msgSnippet: Alan, Are you talking about Kentsu Yabu (1863-1937) who demonstrated karate in Hawaii and then the rest of the US in the 1920s. If so, this may help;
messages.messageBody:
Alan,
Are you talking about Kentsu Yabu (1863-1937) who
demonstrated karate in Hawaii and then the rest of the US
in the 1920s. If so, this may help;

http://seinenkai.com/salute-yabu.html

If not so, sorry.
Michael Lorimer
